screenshots.caption: Screenshot depicting process list of Sleeper 'resident' in memory.

name: QZAntics Sleeper For Windows
short_description:
QZAntics Sleeper For Windows is a very simple program windowless program which sleeps for 'x' amount of seconds on starting up, and then stops - doing absolutely nothing while it's going.

To what end? As a practical joke on a programmer, if you remotely activate this on your favorite developer's system (I will create a distribution program later), on a system the developer 'thinks' they own and control it will drive them insane when they see a handful of weird processes which start up unexpectedly then stop for no reason  I find renaming the process to something innocuously weird such as 'searchfilter' and 'searchhost' to be among the most effective names - nothign malicious, right, just having fun.

Now if you're targeting a superstitious developer. I personally find it particularly effective making comments like 'I wonder if you have a ghost"

BEST suited using a cmd shell with usage as follows:

"SleeperForWindows 30"
summary: QZAntics sleeps for 'x' amount of seconds on starting up and then ends
